channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: 5 reasons why this Samsung vacuum is my #1 home gadget of the year
item.description: Beautiful and functional – what more could you want from a vacuum?

item.title: How to build safe danger and make teams come alive
item.description: Safe Danger creates the space for everyone to engage. Below, Ben Swire shares five key insights from his new book, Safe Danger: An Unexpected Method for Sparking Connection, Finding Purpose, and Inspiring Innovation.

item.title: As the dollar closes out a dismal year, here’s what to expect in 2026
item.description: Longer-term views for dollar weakness notwithstanding, a near-term rebound for the dollar is not to be ruled out, investors cautioned. A dismal year for the U.S. dollar is ending with signs of stabilization, but many investors believe the currency’s decline will resume next year as global growth picks up and the Fed eases further.

item.title: Long-term mortgage rate drops to lowest level of 2025 at 6.15%
item.description: It’s the lowest average long-term mortgage rate since October 3, 2024. The average rate on a 30-year U.S. mortgage fell to its lowest level of 2025 this week, an encouraging sign for prospective home buyers.

item.title: Wall Street slides on the final day of 2025 to close out a record year
item.description: The S&P 500, which set 39 record highs in 2025, is up about 17% for the year, it’s third straight double-digit annual gain. U.S. stocks are slipping in afternoon trading Wednesday as Wall Street closes out a banner year for markets driven by both optimism and uncertainty.

item.title: 25 good things that happened in 2025
item.description: This year had its share of negative news, but here's our selection of the good, positive, upbeat and uplifting stories you may be craving.

item.title: Jobless claims drop to one-month low to cap a tough year for job market
item.description: Claims have been volatile in recent weeks amid challenges in adjusting the data for seasonal fluctuations ahead of the holiday season. Americans filed the fewest new jobless claims in a month last week, and while the number of unemployed workers collecting relief payments has eased from recent highs, there is little indication of a break from the weak hiring environment that settled in over the course of President Donald Trump‘s first year back at the White House....

item.title: Instagram chief: AI is so ubiquitous 'it will be more practical to fingerprint real media than fake media'
item.description: It's no secret that AI-generated content took over our social media feeds in 2025. Now, Instagram's top exec Adam Mosseri has made it clear that he expects AI content to overtake non-AI imagery and the significant implications that shift has for its creators and photographers.Mosseri shared the thoughts in a lengthy post about the broader trends he expects to shape Instagram in 2026. And he offered a notably candid assessment on how AI is upending the platform. "Everything that made creators matter—the ability to be real, to connect, to have a voice that couldn’t be faked—is now suddenly acces...
